channel.title: Opposite of JFileChooser
channel.description:
Anyone know something opposite of JFileChooser?
I'm trying to make a file transfer program and I need to select hte source folder/file (JFileChooser) and then select a destination folder (?). Is there a class for this? Or do I have to make my own?

item.title: Opposite of JFileChooser
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

oh nice. thanks a lot[br][size=1]Posted at: October 24, 2006, 10:08:26 PM[/size][hr]opposite meaning like: JFileChooser and JFileDestination

Read full topic

item.title: Opposite of JFileChooser
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

You can use JFileChooser saving too…all it does is selects the file to save to. Just use the showSaveDialog method. If you want to select the directory, you can simply add something like this:

someFileChooser.setFileSelectionMode(JFileChooser.DIRECTORIES_ONLY);

Read full topic

item.title: Opposite of JFileChooser
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

make two jfilechoosers, one to get source file, another to get destination. Then just use streams and read from one and write to another. I don’t think there is an alternative for this.

And how will this be the opposite? ;|

Read full topic
